summary.para: Retrieves the sample allocator usage for the specified output stream.

param.name: dwOutputStreamID
param.para: The ID of the output stream whose sample allocator usage is requested.

param.name: pdwInputStreamID
param.para: If the allocator usage is , then this output parameter is set to the ID of the input stream that the output samples are coming from. For all other allocator usage values, this parameter is ignored.

param.name: peUsage
param.para: A member of the enumeration specifying the sample allocator usage of the specified output stream.

summary.para: Sets the default sample allocator to use for the specified output stream.

param.name: dwOutputStreamID
param.para: The ID of the output stream that the pAllocator parameter applies to.

param.name: pAllocator
param.para: Receives a pointer to a sample allocator to use for the specified output stream. The allocator supports one of the MF allocator interfaces, such as or .

remarks.para: The system calls this method to provide components with a sample allocator that allows the component to allocate samples using memory that is accessible from within a container.
Components that use the provided allocator should return from calls to .

summary.para: Implemented by video capture sources and transforms. Allows the system to provide components with a sample allocator to allocate samples using memory that is accessible from within a container.

remarks.para: Components that do not implement this interface, or do not use the allocator provided by the system, can still allocate samples, but when running from inside a container, the system will have to copy all samples into container memory, which is less efficient.
